Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2013 10:18PM CeceliaL wrote: Hi my name is Cecelia and I've had a roller coaster of a week. Was diagnosed with breast cancer in both breasts last Tuesday, Grade 3, ER+ and PR+ (still awaiting HER2 results). I've been in and out of hospitals the last week having my MRI and PeT/CT scan done the scans have confirmed 2 tumours in right breast with lymph node action aswell as in the middle of my chest behind the breast bone and one tumour in the left breast. Offcourse I am in shock as I only had my breast scanned 12 months ago. I'm trying to be postive and would really appreciate any stories on similiar cases. I'm finding it so difficult looking at my husband suffer and I just want to hold my 4 year old son and never let him go. Met with my surgen today and he said that we will do a double mastectomy but no reconstruction as they need the best chance for the radiotherapy to work on the  nodes in the chest wall (aparently these can't be surgically removed). I will also have 3 lympnodes removed from under my anrm and breast (he then went on to talking about lymphemia( I turned off at that stage). Sorry I just jumped into this conversation but I suppose I need to start somewhere and I was browsing the discussion boards when I saw Cuetang's post about not sleeping. Any information or words of advice appreciated. Been keeping very positive but seem to have delved into a dark place now.
